comment.body: With [ZeroMe Plus](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Lj1oPcN7oZQL8HkS5KbkzQuKqs42zQWY6), you can just unfollow people.
epub is actually a very standardised format for ebooks. Much better than pdfs for most books because the text reflows automatically.

@Ulrichard: What do you mean? DRM and open formats are two different things. You can have DRM on an open format like PDF or MP4. That doesn't make them not open or bad for the jobs they were designed for. Epub is designed for reflowing text on e-ink readers and for that, it does an amazing job.

@Ulrichard: Ah, I'm not sure. I've only ever had mobi DRM files from Amazon and they were a pain. I think the DRMs on epubs is usually easier to break though. I really hate the fact that I paid Â£10 for a book and can't even lend it to my friends.
@Zerro: I guess the best format is the one that works with your device :) Kindles don't support anything other than mobi which is kinda annoying
Sorry but Weld is the sensible candidate of the duo. Johnson is just a corporatist who doesn't care about anyone but the millionaires.
Have you ever met a refugee?
I couldn't even get it to work when I tried :/ I keep getting a white screen and nothing else.
@Durand: Oh yeah, it works fine now. I tried it a few weeks ago and it was buggy!
Yup, it's absolute crap. I wanted to give my girlfriend an ebook I owned but couldn't because she didn't have a kindle and I can't convert drm-mobi files. Hate it :(

@Dergatt: Exactly. I want the authors/editors of the book to be able to keep making books in the future. Hence why I pay for it. Some problems, like distribution, can be make cheaper through newer technologies but the bulk of the cost is in actually writing and producing that book. There are [alternative book publishers](https://www.versobooks.com/) out there which publish books DRM-free but they are still yet to take off. I think the main reason for this is that established authors don't know enough about DRM and the industry to make an informed decision so they leave it up to their publishers.
You missed out on great shows like The Newsroom!

I thought it was going to be bad but the video was pretty accurate! A lot of youtube videos completely forget about incomes when talking about government spending and make it sound like austerity is a good thing. Anyway, if you liked that, you should check out [Steve Keen's channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCM1ubsbE-tG9ru61mc3zX8A).
This was really well made. Unfortunately, we've had so many documentaries before and people still deny the science..

@Flyman: It's basically about what happens in an American TV news company but that description doesn't do it enough justice. Here's the trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wC8ovJYAU3U It's pretty amazing!
And yeah, I agree. I don't understand how people still watch live TV...
They are different databases for zerome. You should download them all so that you can see what people in other databases write about.
